org.ensembl.driver
Interface AssemblyExceptionAdaptor

All Superinterfaces:
Adaptor, java.rmi.Remote
public interface AssemblyExceptionAdaptor
extends Adaptor

Adaptor for retrieving and handling AssemblyExceptions which are used to represent PARs and haplotypes.

PAR/haplotype sequences can be thought of as series of sequence region chunks. Some of these chunks are specific to the PAR/Haplotype and others are links to parts of "reference" chromosomes. e.g. DR52 consists of sequence regions unique to DR52 and chunks of reference chromosome 6.

As an optimisation Ensembl databases do not store duplicate sequence and features for the regions PAR/haplotypes share with "reference" chromosomes. Instead they store the links between these chunks as AssemblyLocations. This information can be used to retrieving sequence and features for the PARs/Haplotypes that is stored "on" the the reference sequence.

A location on a shared region of a PAR/Haplotype can be converted between the PAR/Haplotype and reference chromosomes via dereference(Location) and reference(Location, String).

See Also:
AssemblyException, dereference(Location), rereference(Location, SequenceRegion)

fetch

public java.util.List fetch(Location loc)
                     throws AdaptorException
Retrieve AssemblyExceptions that are relevant for given location.

They have to be on the same sequence region with their linked Location.

Parameters:
loc -
Returns:
zero or more AssemblyExceptions that overlap the given location
Throws:
AdaptorException

dereference

public Location dereference(Location loc)
                     throws AdaptorException
Dereferences the request location. Features for some seq regions , e.g. human chromosome:DR51, are stored in chunks where some of the chunks are actually references to other sequence regions e.g. chromosome:6. e.g. chromosome:DR51 -> [chromosome:6:1-b, chromosome:DR51:1-c, chromosome:6:d-end]

Parameters:
loc - location (list) to be dereferenced.
Returns:
location (list) corresponding to loc containing one or more nodes, or null if no mapping is possible.
Throws:
AdaptorException
See Also:
rereference(Location, SequenceRegion), hasReferences(Location)

rereference

public Location rereference(Location loc,
                            SequenceRegion targetSeqRegion)
                     throws AdaptorException
Refereferences the source locations. Maps the locations into the specified coordinate system and target sequence name if possible. e.g. [chromosome:6:1-b, chromosome:DR51:1-c, chromosome:6:d-end] -> chromosome:DR51

Parameters:
loc - source location (list) to be rereferenced
targetSeqRegion - sequence region to convert locations into (if necessary)
Returns:
location (list) on targetSeqRegion, or null if a mapping is not possible.
Throws:
AdaptorException
See Also:
hasReferences(Location)

hasReferences

public boolean hasReferences(Location loc)
                      throws AdaptorException
Determines whether loc includes references to other locations.

Parameters:
loc - location to test.
Returns:
true if loc contains references, otherwise false.
Throws:
AdaptorException
